summary: This bill, the Expanding Seniors’ Access to PFAS Testing Act, aims to amend Title XVIII of the Social Security Act to provide no-cost coverage for PFAS testing under the Medicare program. It defines PFAS testing as a blood test ordered by a physician to determine the concentration of perfluoroalkyl and polyfluoroalkyl substances. The bill specifies the application of no cost-sharing for this testing, effective January 1, 2028, and outlines the payment structure for the services.
